docs.lead_paragraph: "Top Chef" judge Gail Simmons is joining anti-hunger advocates and the officials who serve 850,000 New York City school meals a day to raise awareness of childhood nutrition issues.

headline.main: 'Top Chef' Judge Simmons Joins NY School Nutrition Effort
headline.print_headline: 'Top Chef' Judge Simmons Joins NY School Nutrition Effort

docs.snippet: "Top Chef" judge Gail Simmons is joining anti-hunger advocates and the officials who serve 850,000 New York City school meals a day to raise awareness of childhood nutrition issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House is moving quickly on a compromise GOP budget that promises to speed repeal of the nation's health care law and calls for a major budget hike for the Pentagon.

headline.main: House Adopts Compromise GOP Budget Targeting 'Obamacare'
headline.print_headline: House Adopts Compromise GOP Budget Targeting 'Obamacare'

docs.snippet: The House is moving quickly on a compromise GOP budget that promises to speed repeal of the nation's health care law and calls for a major budget hike for the Pentagon.

docs.lead_paragraph: Milan's Expo 2015 world's fair has heady ambitions, the biggest of which is to devise a plan to feed the planet as it brings together 145 nations to focus on food and nutrition.

headline.main: Food, Italy and Milan: Expo 2015 Seeks to Feed the Planet
headline.print_headline: Food, Italy and Milan: Expo 2015 Seeks to Feed the Planet

docs.snippet: Milan's Expo 2015 world's fair has heady ambitions, the biggest of which is to devise a plan to feed the planet as it brings together 145 nations to focus on food and nutrition.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic Gov. Jay Nixon vetoed Republican legislation Thursday that would drop thousands of low-income families from Missouri's welfare rolls by paring back benefits to what he said would be one of the shortest time periods in the nation.

headline.main: Missouri Governor Vetoes Bill Cutting Welfare Benefits
headline.print_headline: Missouri Governor Vetoes Bill Cutting Welfare Benefits

docs.snippet: Democratic Gov. Jay Nixon vetoed Republican legislation Thursday that would drop thousands of low-income families from Missouri's welfare rolls by paring back benefits to what he said would be one of the shortest time periods in the nation.

docs.lead_paragraph: In Upton-Druid Heights — one of Baltimore’s poorest neighborhoods and the scene of some of its most vocal protests — residents die from nearly every major disease at substantially higher rates than the city as a whole.

headline.main: Health Problems Take Root in a West Baltimore Neighborhood That Is Sick of Neglect
headline.print_headline: Health Problems Take Root in a Neighborhood That Is Sick of Neglect

docs.abstract: Residents of West Baltimore's poverty-stricken Upton-Druid Heights neighborhood, which is 94 percent black, die from almost every major disease at significantly higher rates than rest of city and their life expectancy is just 68 years; statistics underlie anger and frustration of poor black Americans that is at heart of ongoing nationwide protests about policing.
docs.snippet: In Upton-Druid Heights — one of Baltimore’s poorest neighborhoods and the scene of some of its most vocal protests — residents die from nearly every major disease at substantially higher rates than the city as a whole.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Bob Corker, Republican of Tennessee, lifted his blockade of a House-Senate deal that would cut $5 trillion in spending over the next decade to balance the federal budget.

headline.main: Bob Corker Ends Blockade of Budget Deal
headline.print_headline: Lawmaker Ends Blockade of Budget Deal

docs.abstract: Sen Bob Corker, Republican of Tennessee, lifts his blockade of House-Senate budget agreement that would cut $5 trillion in spending in next decade to balance federal budget.
docs.snippet: Senator Bob Corker, Republican of Tennessee, lifted his blockade of a House-Senate deal that would cut $5 trillion in spending over the next decade to balance the federal budget.

docs.lead_paragraph: A 214-pound Queens housewife struggled with a lifelong addiction to food until she shed 72 pounds and became the public face of the worldwide weight-control empire.

headline.main: Jean Nidetch, a Founder of Weight Watchers, Dies at 91
headline.print_headline: Jean Nidetch, 91, Is Dead; Founded Weight Watchers

docs.abstract: Jean Nidetch, co-founder of weight-loss behemoth Weight Watchers, dies at age 91; once overweight Queens housewife who struggled with food addiction, Nidetch transformed herself in early 1960s, shedding 72 pounds, and in doing so helped create a diet plan and support system that would reshape many millions of people for decades to come.
docs.snippet: A 214-pound Queens housewife struggled with a lifelong addiction to food until she shed 72 pounds and became the public face of the worldwide weight-control empire.

headline.main: Exploring Why Some People Get Fitter Than Others

docs.abstract: A new study in rats adds to a growing body of data about how and why bodies respond so differently to exercise.
docs.snippet: A new study in rats adds to a growing body of data about how and why bodies respond so differently to exercise.

docs.lead_paragraph: Outside Katmandu, people are anxious to find out what happened to their relatives and homes after the devastating quake.

headline.main: Across Nepal’s Countryside, Desperate Journeys to Ruined Homes After Quake
headline.print_headline: Across Nepal’s Countryside, Desperate Journeys to Ruined Homes

docs.abstract: Villages near epicenter of earthquake in Nepal are badly damaged and difficult to reach, leaving residents largely without outside help; landslides continue and regularly block roads, hindering progress by aid workers.
docs.snippet: Outside Katmandu, people are anxious to find out what happened to their relatives and homes after the devastating quake.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Katmandu, Nepal, and Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong.
